Description:
January 2006

To the Theater Rice,

The ASUC is very excited to invite you to perform in the From All Perspectives multi-cultural and performing arts showcase on Thursday, April 20th, 2006 in Zellerbach Hall at 7 pm.

A collaborative effort between the ASUC and about fifteen to twenty student performing arts groups, From All Perspectives brings together the many different communities at Cal. It is a night to celebrate the cultural milieu unique to the Berkeley campus and a time for the campus as a whole – regardless of any affiliation – to come together and enjoy the diversity of our great school. From All Perspectives seeks to unite all of Berkeley and not just specific segments. Singing, dancing, theater and cultural groups from several different backgrounds will perform in a two to three hour show tailored for the enjoyment of all. From All Perspectives hopes to reach a wide audience by offering a variety of performances on a world-class stage with affordable ticket prices ranging from about $8-$10. Not only is From All Perspectives a chance to enjoy a show in an at minimum $30 per seat venue, but also an opportunity for everyone in the Berkeley community to experience a little bit of everything.

We would be honored for Theater Rice to join us in this effort to promote the diversity of Cal. Not only is this an opportunity for the campus to benefit, but it is also a chance for your group to gain exposure amongst a wide audience base. Zellerbach Hall seats about 2000 people and with the partnership of groups that will be participating, Theater Rice will be able to reach a wider audience for prospective shows.

As a collaborative effort, we would like Theater Rice to take an active role in the execution of this show. We are currently looking for a Stage Manager and would love for him or her to come from the ranks of the participating student groups. The ASUC cannot do this alone; it is the student groups who will ensure the success of the From All Perspectives show.

We are providing Zellerbach Hall, but we need your cooperation to help secure the success of this collaboration. In order to be a part of this show, we need the accountability of the Theater Rice. Besides performing on the day of the show, Theater Rice would also need to go to the rehearsal on Wednesday, April 19th, 2006.We are also asking all participating groups to sell a very reasonable number of tickets (at maximum five per performer) for the show. Each group will be financially responsible for these tickets.

We are currently working to procure outside funds in order to cover the costs of Zellerbach Hall, publicity, etc. so that any profit can be given to the participating groups. We want Theater Rice to be able to benefit from the show because From All Perspectives is for you. For each extra ticket Theater Rice sells past its required number, it will receive a share of the ticket profit. Presently, we are considering several options for this arrangement.

We would greatly appreciate any feedback and opinions. This show is for you and it is nothing without you.
We will send a follow-up e-mail within the next week. Please consider this invitation. We would love for Theater Rice to be a part of the 2006 From All Perspectives show!

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us. We would love to hear from you!

Thank you for your time and attention.


GO BEARS,
